alert.note: Alert for Butler; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 7:21PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Sedgwick and west central Butler Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 720 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haysville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Clearwater, Towanda, Benton, Downtown Wichita, Kechi, Eastborough, Northeast Wichita, East Wichita, Mcconnell Air Force Base, South Wichita and Santa Fe Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 11. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 34 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Kansas.
